noun.description: A blood clot, air bubble, piece of fatty deposit, or other object which has been carried in the bloodstream to lodge in a vessel and cause an embolism.

origin: Mid 17th century (denoting something inserted or moving within another, specifically the plunger of a syringe): from Latin, literally piston, from Greek embolos peg, stopper. The current sense dates from the mid 19th century.
